history.content: imo this will be really hard for you. 162 and 170 have workloads decently above the lower div workload, over double that of 188 imo (in addition to being conceptually harder). 161 also has an enormous project in the middle fo the semester. This will not be fun for you at all and you may not get out of it with good grades/sanity, but if you must due to personal reasons, then I guess you don't have much of a choice.

children.subject: Haha thanks for the answers! If I get lucky I might only have to take 3 classes in the fall, and if that happens I will be much better off. I am also considering taking 186 instead of 162 during the fall and take 162 in the spring along with 189 and ee16b. Was wondering if the course load would be manageable, but I guess it's better to be safe than risk failing a class or lose my sanity in the process lol.
161 could take ~15hr/week especially with the project mentioned above. I don't think it's a great idea to combine 162, 170, and 161.
I did that this last Spring and it's doable. There are some spikes where the workload increases, but it's not as hard as other combinations of classes.
Haha yeah looking at the feedbacks I'm reconsidering my plan right now - how does 170, 161, 186, and ee16a sound? Or 170, 162, and ee16a? Thanks for your input!
188 and 70 combined take maybe half the time of 170 or 162. Please do not do this.

history.content:
Hi, I know the list above probably sounds ridiculous (I am also taking CS195 and doing recruiting in the fall), but trying to graduate early (next spring) due to personal reasons.

I am taking CS70 and 188 together during the summer right now and doing okay (top 15~30 percentile from midterm grades). My adviser told me that I should be able to survive as long as I manage my time really well, but I also wanted to hear from the student perspective. I am not one of those in the "genius" range who seems to be the best in class with minimal effort, but just work really hard and long.

What were the number of hours you had to put into those classes? I know it would really vary student to student, but considering that I am just an average student, I think it will give me a better estimate on how much time I would need to delegate for each classes.

Some of the numbers I have seen are 15~20hr/week for 170, and 20hr/week for 162, but I really have no idea how much workload 161 and 16A will be despite looking around for a while.

Thanks for all the help!
history.subject: Am I insane if I am planning to take CS162, 170, 161, and EE16A together?
